item.title: Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma for Switch, PC delayed to June 5
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/rune-factory-guardians-of-azuma-for-switch-pc-delayed-to-june-5

  • PC
  • Switch

Now launching alongside Switch 2 version.

The Switch and PC (Steam) versions have been delayed by one week from May 30 to June 5 to launch alongside the newly announced Switch 2 version, publisher Marvelous announced.

Get the latest details below.

The latest entry in the popular action–RPG and life-simulation series will now launch alongside the Nintendo Switch 2 version simultaneously. Players will experience the Eastern territory of Azuma for the first time, a land of Japanese-inspired visuals and unique twists on familiar gameplay elements from the Rune Factory franchise. Those playing on Nintendo Switch 2 will experience the title in a higher resolution with improved frame rates, along with Joy-Con 2 mouse controls for village building.

The company also announced that those who have pre-ordered the Nintendo Switch version of Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma will be able to play on the new platform with the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition upgrade pack. Details regarding the upgrade pack will be available at a later date.

Additionally, Marvelous USA today revealed the Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma “Earth Dancer Accessory Set,” a limited box set containing the original soundtrack consisting of 56 tracks across two CDs, a 160-page art book, an Azuma-inspired folding fan, and a plush Woolby keychain together in a custom outer box. Limited quantities of this special set will be available for pre-order soon exclusively on the Marvelous USA Online Store for an MSRP of $49.99.
